Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.model.players.cpustrategies

Class DefensiveStrategy

java.lang.Object
fr.sos.witchhunt.model.players.cpustrategies.CPUStrategy
fr.sos.witchhunt.model.players.cpustrategies.DefensiveStrategy
All Implemented Interfaces:
PlayStrategy
public class DefensiveStrategy extends CPUStrategy

This strategy will be chosen by the CPUPlayer when they feel threatened : If the game is tied, if the leading players are far above in score, if this player has no cards left, or if this player plays as a witch and is not close to victory.

It will be likely to choose to play as a witch, as this suits well a defensive playstyle.

It will focus the leading players, excepted when a player is ready to receive the finishing blow.

Chooses cards based mostly on their Witch? effect,values cards tagged as able to protect and avoids risked cards.

Easily feels short on cards.

A witch using this strategy witch will never reveal their identity unless they have no more playable Witch? effects in their hand.

See Also:
  • PlayStrategy
  • CPUStrategy

  • Method Details

    • selectIdentity

      public Identity selectIdentity()

      Chooses an identity.

      VILLAGER is more suited for a player with an aggressive playstyle, while WITCH corresponds better to a player with a defensive or careful playstyle

      This strategy will be likely to choose to play as a witch, as this suits well a defensive and careful playstyle. There is still a little chance to choose to play as a villager.
      Returns:
      Either VILLAGER or WITCH.
      See Also:
      • Identity
      • CPUPlayer::chooseIdentity()

    • selectTurnAction

      public TurnAction selectTurnAction(Identity identity, RumourCardsPile myHand, boolean canHunt)

      Chooses an action to perform on the player's turn, based on the current situation.

      When playing as a witch, a CPU Player will logically be more likely to choose to accuse another player, and even more when the situation becomes critical.

      There is always a chance of choosing to play a play a Hunt! effect, excepted when the player only has risked Hunt! effects.

      This strategy will be more likely to avoid playing Hunt! effect than others, and will almost always choose to accuse.

      If the calling player is VILLAGER, the more cards they have, the more likely it is to choose to hunt - but still unlikely.

      Otherwise, if they are a WITCH, they will be very likely to choose to accuse, even more if they feel short on cards.

      Independantly of the calling player's identity, if there are only risked cards or cards with non-valuable Hunt! effects, within their hand, systematically chooses to accuse.

      Specified by:
      selectTurnAction in interface PlayStrategy
      Overrides:
      selectTurnAction in class CPUStrategy
      Parameters:
      identity - The calling cpu-controlled player's identity.
      myHand - The calling cpu-controlled player's hand.
      canHunt - A boolean indicating whether the calling cpu-controlled player can or can't hunt.
      Returns:
      Either ACCUSE or HUNT.
      See Also:
      • TurnAction
      • CPUPlayer::chooseTurnAction()

    • selectPlayerToAccuse

      public Player selectPlayerToAccuse(List<Player> accusablePlayersList)

      Selects a player to accuse within a list.

      This strategy will priorize accusing players with exactly 0 or 2 cards - if there are none, they will target the leading players.
      Parameters:
      accusablePlayersList - The list within which a player must be accused
      Returns:
      The chosen target
      See Also:
      • Tabletop::getLeadingPlayers()

    • selectWitchCard

      public RumourCard selectWitchCard(RumourCardsPile rcp)
      Selects a Rumour card valued for its Witch? effect within a given pile of Rumour cards. When choosing a card to trigger its Witch? effect, this strategy will try selecting the cards with the best one. Among the cards with the best witch effects, will choose the ones with the best overall value. Among this selection, will choose the ones with the worse Hunt! effects.
      Parameters:
      rcp - The pile of Rumour cards within which the choice can be made.
      Returns:
      A Rumour card from the player's hand chosen for its Witch? effect in particular.
      See Also:
      • CardValueMap
      • CardValueMap.getCardsWithMaxWitchValue(RumourCardsPile)
      • CardValueMap.getCardsWithMaxOverallValue(RumourCardsPile)
      • CardValueMap.getCardsWithMaxHuntValue(RumourCardsPile)

    • selectNextPlayer

      public Player selectNextPlayer(List<Player> list)

      Selects a player to take the next turn.

      Most strategies will avoid giving the next turn to the leading players.

      This strategy will always select the players with the lowest score to play the next turn.
      Parameters:
      list - A list of players within which the next player has to be selected.
      Returns:
      The chosen player to take the next turn.
      See Also:
      • CPUPlayer::chooseNextPlayer()

    • selectHuntCard

      public RumourCard selectHuntCard(RumourCardsPile rcp)
      Selects a Rumour card valued for its Hunt! effect within a given pile of Rumour cards. Default definition of what is the best Hunt! card to play for a strategy.

      This strategy will make a pre-selection of all cards with positive Hunt! effect values, that aren't risked, that are decisive, that are able to give cards or that grant a protection.

      If this pre-selection contains cards, it will choose within it the cards with the best Hunt! effects. Otherwise, it will choose, within all eligible cards, the ones with the best Hunt! effects, among the ones with the worst Witch? effects..

      Specified by:
      selectHuntCard in interface PlayStrategy
      Overrides:
      selectHuntCard in class CPUStrategy
      Parameters:
      rcp - The pile of Rumour cards within which the choice can be made.
      Returns:
      The card with the best Hunt! effect value within the given deck.
      See Also:
      • CardValueMap
      • CardValue
      • CardValue.isRisked()
      • CardValue.isDecisive()
      • CardValue.protects()
      • CardValue.givesCards()
      • CardValueMap.getCardsWithMinWitchValue(RumourCardsPile)
      • CardValueMap.getCardsWithMaxHuntValue(RumourCardsPile)

    • selectCardToDiscard

      public RumourCard selectCardToDiscard(RumourCardsPile rcp)
      Selects a Rumour card to discard within a given a given pile of Rumour cards. This strategy will consider as the worse cards, the ones with the worst overall values, among the ones with the worst Witch? effects.
      Specified by:

      Overrides:

      Returns:
      the worst card found within the given deck.

    • selectBestCard

      public RumourCard selectBestCard(RumourCardsPile rcp, boolean seeUnrevealedCards)
      Selects the best card according to the strategy within a given pile of Rumour cards. Useful when picking a new card or taking back a revealed card from your own hand. Default definition for what is the "best" card within a pile.

      This strategy will consider as the best cards, the ones with the best overall values, among the ones with the best Witch? effects (priority is given on Witch? effects).

      Unrevealed cards will have equal chances than the best reveal cards to be chosen.

      Specified by:
      selectBestCard in interface PlayStrategy
      Overrides:
      selectBestCard in class CPUStrategy
      Parameters:
      rcp - The pile of Rumour cards within which the best card has to be selected.
      seeUnrevealedCards - If this boolean is true, the strategy will be able to access the properties of unrevealed cards as well.
      Returns:
      A random card in a list made of the cards with the best overall value + the unrevealed cards if they can't be seen
      See Also:
      • CPUStrategy.selectBestCard(RumourCardsPile, boolean)
      • CardValue
      • CardValueMap
